author: Arsene Lupin III
subject: Re: Rupan on DVD?!
body:
> I thought it was later given the title "Lupin vs
> Fukeshi Ningen" in Japan 
> after Cagliostro was released.  

Possibly. But in the trailer for "Plot of the Fuma
Clan" it begins with "1978: "Lupin III"... 1979:
"Castle of Cagliostro"... "1985: The Golden Legend of
Babylon.... Lupin has returned!!.. Lupin: PotFC...etc,
etc." I think that, since the title "Lupin the Third"
was the films orginal title, it should retain it in a
domestic release.
"Lupin the Third"
(The Movie)
See, It's not so bad, is it?

> My Japanese isn't
> that good, but I think 
> that translates into "Lupin vs Immortal Men".

I'll go look up "Fukeshi" real quick-like....
....
Grr. I'll have to figure out the kanji by visiting a
Japanese site on Lupin. But I know it's either
"immortal men" or "duplicate men". Cause I know that
at least "ningen" means "men"

> That
> title doesn't give away 
> as much of plot as the "Clone" title.  Is there a
> japanese word for "clone" 
> or is it a katakana like "ko ro n"?

In Japan, the film trailors in "Secret Files" call it
"Lupin VS. Kuroon"

> The story I
> heard for how the title 
> Mystery of Mamo came about was that it was coined by
> an american translator 
> who made up the name.  In fact, there was a previous
> Lupin villian called 
> Mamo (Mamoo?) from the second TV series.

Likely you mean Carl Macek, former CEO of Streamline
Pictures, which distributed it in English.

> While we're on the topic of this film, I heard
> rumors that an english 
> semi-profesional fan dub of this does exist with a
> script that is very 
> faithful to the original script and characters. 
> This was apparently made in 
> the early 80's or very late 70's.  Can anyone shed
> some light on this?

Yeesh, almost immediately post-release, eh? Wow, I
have no clue. I won't spread this rumor on, say, the
Lupin club or LupintheThird.com until I see proof of
its existence (preferably like I did Lupin the
Eighth.... heehee)...
